isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR (ELECTRIC) AND COMPONENTS

svcproc.title: REMOVE
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 73, Figure 74 and Figure 75.

figure.caption: Figure 73. A/C, Heater, Defroster Flex Hoses
Figure 74. View of Electric Wiper Motor
Figure 75. Electric Wiper Motor Assembly Components

step1.para: Remove center top section of dash panel and fuse panel cover for access.
Remove screws securing flex duct hoses. Remove A/C, heater, and defroster flex hoses ( Figure 73 and Figure 74)
Remove screw retaining dash panel brace rod at windshield area. Move rod aside.
Remove left and center defroster duct grill cover.
Remove screws retaining defroster duct tube to dash panel assembly.

Remove screws (2) from inside edge of dash panel at windshield area and at left and right side panel where they join at windshield area. This will allow the dash panel to flex when removing defroster duct tube.
Pull defroster duct tube from dash panel assembly.
Pull electrical wire harness next to wiper motor back about 3 or 4 inches (76 or 102 mm) for access to wiper motor.

note.para: Wire harness is difficult to pull. Be sure that you do not break or pull any other wires from their connections.
When working with tools in the open dash area, be careful that you do not touch tools to hot electrical connections.

step1.para: Remove the two T30 Torx head machine screws securing wiper motor mounting bracket to body mounting plate ( Figure 75).

note.para: The wiper motor mounting bracket lower section is secured to the body mounting plate by pins, with heads on the pins. These pins fit into a hole with a slot and slide to the right side about 3/8 inch (9.5 mm). This secures the wiper motor mounting bracket lower section to the body mounting plate ( Figure 75).

step1.para: If wiper motor will operate, turn ignition key to ON position. Momentarily operate wiper switch to move wiper motor assembly to the left (driver's side) about 3/8 inch (9.5 mm). Stop wiper action when this is achieved. Turn key to OFF position. If motor does not operate, it may be necessary to tap the motor assembly to the left (driver's side) to release it from the slots in the body panel.
Grab wire harness and pull back about 3 or 4 inches (76 or 102 mm). Then pull out wiper motor assembly from body mounting plate. If wiper motor is not free of body mounting plate, repeat step 10.

Pull motor assembly back from mounting plate and remove spring clip retaining wiper linkage to wiper motor arm. Note the location of the linkage on the wiper motor arm and remove linkage from arm ( Figure 75).
Remove electrical connection from motor. Remove motor.

note.para: The wiper motor, mounting bracket, arm and nut are serviced as one unit.
